name: Exiles RPG
description:
Remember the oldest question in any classic fantasy RPG? "why would anyone, ever, leave their homes and lives and jobs to go do this really dangerous and unfun work?"

Well, I thought of one community that had very few options: Jews. they were often denied work, demonized, and kicked out of their homes. some turned to money loaning (those who already had a good amount of money), others to piracy, others traveled far to find places that accepted them for their trades... but if there were monsters to kill and treasures to find, I'm certain a few of them would have turned to dungeon delving.

the mechanics are very simple and can be easily used for other settings, and on the other hand, the setting is easily transferable to other systems. lastly, this game was written from a Jewish perspective but could also be transferred to other peoples in the same situation such as the Romani, I would love to read something like that if someone does that send it my way.
